Articles.Content: Yep, it's another name suggestion. I just downloaded Roverdude's rover and I would like some suggestions for the names besides Karibou?

Spik3.

IDK Y but "rover" always makes me think "dog"

Korolla, Korsa, Katerham, Krysler, Kruiser, Kolt, Kontinental, Kortina, Kestarossa, Korvette, Kougar, Kayenne, Kountach, Kuantum, Wildkat, Viktor, Vankuish, Skamp, Spektra, Maybakh, Mikra.

And my personal favourite:

Kevin.
I often name spaceplanes after birds, so analogously I often name rovers after land mammals. Skwerl, Wolf, Cheetah, etc.

"Won't flip MK I", "Certainly won't flip MK II", ...

(general rover names, not related to RoverDude's awesome creations )

"Won't flip MK I", "Certainly won't flip MK II", ...

"Tumbleweed"
Kuriosity?
Flipper ?
Hermes, or Bucephalus.
Sirius, perhaps?
I have one named "Jeep". lol
Rover Cleveland

Mako or Hammerhead

Or Ricochet (one of my favorite RC cars growing up since it had tank steer and was invertible)

Edited September 17, 2015 by Lord Aurelius
I like "Scarab," principally because I tend to name my designs after Ancient Egyptian themes, but it's also a semi-obscure "Battlestar Galactica" reference.

Roving Vehicle.

It's certainly not wrong, right?

- - - Updated - - -

I have one named "Jeep". lol

I had a design called the iJeep.

TheMoonRover

But I usually just call mine things like "Duna Rover" or "Minmus Hovercraft" etc.

How about naming them after land animals, for example: the mouse, the kitten (for small rovers), the badger, the wolfhound (for larger ones), the tiger, the rhino (for even bigger ones), or the elephant (for a roving base)
I called my creation the Nomad ! because if a thing can move it's nomad so...
There are some that call me.... Tim?

R.O.V.E.R - Reliable Off-road Vehicle for Exploration and Reconnaissance

Happy landings!
I named mine oppritunity to honor the mars rover
Rovey McRoverface
Hope

After some exceptions in the first part of my career, I now name my rovers based on the similarity with common object. A rover with four "columns" and a flat surface got named Stool, an U-shaped one was dubbed Horseshoe. A plane became Arrowhead.

I commonly name my spaceships after stars and constellations (Arkturus, Sirius, Nova, Eridani...) and rovers and bases after minerals (Ruby, Emerald, Beryllium, Amethyst...), for surface stuff being on ground so I choose things deep underground, and space stuff being in space so I choose things far away in deep space, for symbolic reasons. Thus my surface stuff will stay on ground and my space stuff will go deeper in the cold Universe.

Edited February 2, 2022 by Nazalassa
[Jeb] Hey Bob, going to climb that mountain over there? Have fun! (Kerbin Sorta-Circumnavigtion, by Purpleivan.)

If I can't think of names, I usually go with acronyms such as MMEV, or Munar Multipurpose Exploration Vehicle.

 

Spoiler

Or you could also name it 'vroom vroom drive machine'
